value.subject: About my current situation on course 15.563
value.bodyPreview:
Hi Prof. Raghavan,

I returned to Beijing on this Monday, since one of my family members just encountered a heart attack issue on Sunday evening and finished a successful operation this Monday.

Since I need time accompany my family, I cannot particip

body.content:
Hi Prof. Raghavan,

 

I returned to Beijing on this Monday, since one of my family members just encountered a heart attack issue on Sunday evening and finished a successful operation this Monday.

Since I need time accompany my family, I cannot participate in the course in person in the second half of the term.
Could I continue work on this course remotely, including the assignments? 


Best,
Jiannan

value.subject: Apply for a Ph.D. position starting Fall 2024
value.bodyPreview:
Hi Prof. ,

My interest area is LLM and its application.

I want to apply for a Ph.D. position starting Fall 2024. Or do you have a research assistant position in 2024?

I have hands-on LLM research experience in the Apple Siri Beijing Office in the

body.content:
Hi Prof. ,

 

My interest area is LLM and its application.

 

I want to apply for a Ph.D. position starting Fall 2024. Or do you have a research assistant position in 2024?

 

I have hands-on LLM research experience in the Apple Siri Beijing Office in the Spring and Summer of 2023. My resume is attached. I am looking forward to your reply.

 

Thanks!

Jiannan

value.subject: MIT Medical's Annual Flu Clinics: October 2-6
value.bodyPreview:
Flu vaccine clinics Oct. 2–6

View online version

To the MIT community,

Flu season is upon us, and we strongly recommend a flu vaccine to help protect you from influenza this year. This email contains important information about when you can get y

body.content:
Flu vaccine clinics Oct. 2–6

View online version

To the MIT community,

Flu season is upon us, and we strongly recommend a flu vaccine to help protect you from influenza this year. This email contains important information about when you can get your immunization:

This year, MIT Medical will hold flu clinics Monday–Friday, October 2–6, 8 a.m.–4 p.m. in Morss Hall in Walker Memorial (Building 50). These clinics are free to everyone who is eligible to get a vaccine on campus.

Who is eligible for the 2023 flu clinic?

  • All enrolled students living on or off campus
  • All non-students who live on campus, including family members and children aged six months and older
  • All employees and contractors with an MIT ID
  • All patients with a primary care provider at MIT Medical, including children older than six months

If you are a student

To minimize crowding, please try to get your vaccine according to the following schedule, based on last name:

  • A–G: Monday, October 2
  • H–M: Tuesday, October 3
  • N–S: Wednesday, October 4
  • T–Z: Thursday, October 5

If you can’t make it on the date corresponding to your last name, you can come to the clinic any day from October 2–6.

If you are an employee

Come to the clinic on a day of the week that you normally work. There’s no need to make a special trip to campus.

If you are an MIT Medical patient

Come to the clinic any day from October 2–6.

If you are over age 65

High-dose vaccines will be available at all times.

If you are bringing children

Clinicians who can give vaccines to pediatric patients will be available at all times. However, if your baby has an upcoming six-month well-child visit at MIT Medical, they will receive their flu vaccine at that scheduled appointment.

Other things you need to know

  • Bring your MIT ID or your MIT Atlas app. We can scan the barcode in the app if you don’t have your MIT ID.
  • Wear flu-vaccine-friendly clothing with short sleeves. If it is cold, wear a single, easy-to-remove outer layer, like a jacket.

If you need documentation

  • Paper receipts are available upon request; ask a staff member at the clinic.
  • If you’re an MIT Medical patient, you can get documentation of your vaccination through our patient portal, HealthELife.

Can’t come to the flu clinic? Other options are available.

  • All MIT-sponsored insurance plans will allow you to get your flu vaccine anywhere Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts is accepted.
  • Get your flu vaccine at a retail pharmacy, like CVS or Walgreens.
  • Attend a flu clinic in your community.
  • Get the flu vaccine from your primary care provider.
  • If you’re an MIT Medical patient, get the flu vaccine at your next primary care visit.

About this year’s vaccine

The 2023–24 flu vaccine offered at MIT is quadrivalent, protecting against two strains of influenza A (H1N1 and H3N2) and two strains of influenza B. The vaccine does not provide protection for COVID-19. To get a COVID-19 vaccine, you should visit a local pharmacy or your primary care provider.

COVID-19 vaccines will not be available at these flu clinics.

Active flu strains are different each year, so even if you got a flu vaccine last year, you still need to get this year’s vaccine. More information about this year’s vaccine is available from the CDC (CDC Vaccine Information Statement) and the Commonwealth of Massachusetts (Massachusetts Immunization Information System).

Questions? Send an email to comments-fluinfo@mit.edu.

Wishing you a safe and healthy flu season,

Cecilia Stuopis, M.D.
Medical Director, MIT Medical

Massachusetts Institute of Technology
77 Massachusetts Ave | Cambridge, MA 02139

This email has been sent to jiannan@mit.edu. 
You received this email because you are a member of MIT's faculty or staff, or an MIT student.
Click here to unsubscribe. Report an issue with this email.

body.content:
E-Form Receipt: Student Status

Thank you for submitting your e-form request, Student Status, to the MIT International Students Office (ISO).

Please note that some e-forms may require ISO review before approval.  These requests take up to 10 business days to process.  You may check on the status of your application by returning to the e-form submission page.  The application will remain in 'Pending' status until the ISO approves the form.

value.subject: MIT BJ | Summer Send-off & MIT alumna 150 with QIN Xiaoting
value.bodyPreview:
Send-off & Talk

View in browser

MIT CLUB OF



BEIJING



This year's summer send-off will be a special double-bill happening - Welcoming incoming & meet-up with current undergraduate & graduate students and fellow alums, and Celebrating the

body.content:
Send-off & Talk

View in browser

MIT CLUB OF

 

BEIJING

This year's summer send-off will be a special double-bill happening - Welcoming incoming & meet-up with current undergraduate & graduate students and fellow alums, and Celebrating the 150th Anniversary of the first female graduate from MIT in 1873.

EVENT PAGE
EVENT PAGE

MIT Association of Women Students, 1893.  Image from the Women@MIT Project file. Courtesy MIT Museum.

With this, the MIT Club of Beijing is proud to invite students to come and introduce herself and himself, and to present one of our recent alumna, Dr. QIN Xiaoting 秦小婷 (Physics PhD '22) to share with us on the support MIT offers to female students, Microsoft provides to its female employees & to female students, female role models in STEM, and sharing her insights and key learnings from her own experience, as well as some interesting global female make-up in the technology field.  The talk will be conducted in Chinese, for time efficiency.

 

今年的 “开学啦”聚会 不但是欢迎新生及与现时的学生和研究生及校友们聚聚。。。今年还是MIT第一位女毕业生的150周年庆。因此 MIT北京校友会 特别邀请了一位我们的优秀年青女毕业生，秦小婷博士，来与我们分享 MIT对女性学生的支持、微软提供给女性学生和同事的支持，STEM领域中的女性榜样和她的个人经历，并且一些全球数据技术工作中的女性比例。 当日因为时间的关系将以中文交流为主。

 

Summer Send-off

&

MIT Alumna 150

with

QIN Xiaoting 秦小婷

on

Resources for Female STEM Students/Professionals

 

2023.08.05 (Next Sat 下周六)

15:00

每位 ¥100元 per pax

MIT Students ¥0 在读生免费

包括一份饮料及小点

 

致敬酒吧 Tribute Pub

北京朝阳区朝阳公园好运街

Please register using the QR code found on the event page!

Guest Speaker

QIN Xiaoting 秦小婷

Xiaoting QIN is a researcher at Microsoft, focusing on data-driven technologies for cloud intelligence. She obtained her bachelor degree from Taishan College, a top-notch students training program in Shandong University in 2014, and her PhD in the Physics area from MIT in 2022 under the supervision of Nobel Laureate Professor Samuel TING.  QIN has published 28 papers across diverse disciplines with more than 4000 citations.  She is a fervent advocate for women in STEM and a strong proponent of diversity and inclusivity.  QIN actively participated in MIT Graduate Women in Physics community and served as volunteer guide for scientific events. Currently, she actively participates in Ada workshop (the international organization named after the first computer programmer Ada LOVELACE), with the objective to empower female students in STEM - Science Technology Engineering & Math - fields, in the Give program , and volunteers her service in the Person with Disability program in Microsoft.

 

秦小婷是微软的一名研究员专注于云智能的数据驱动技术。她2014年毕业山东大学泰山学堂基础学科拔尖学生培养试验计划，于2022年在麻省理工学院获得博士学位于物理范围，师从诺贝尔奖获得者丁肇中教授。她在多个学科领域发表了28篇论文，被引用超过4000次。秦小婷是位科学技术工程数学领域的女性、热情拥护者和多样性与包容性的坚定倡导者，她积极参与麻省理工学院物理系研究生女性社群，并担任科学活动的志愿导览员。她现积极参与全球的Ada Workshop组织，为STEM(科学、技术、工程、数学相关的专业）领域的女性学生提供支持，参与Give项目，并在微软的残障人士项目中提供志愿服务。

Enquiries

Lulu TSAO 曹诚漪: WeChat 18601683110, lulu_tsao@alum.mit.edu

MIT BJ: WeChat 157 1122 7564, beijing@alum.mit.ed

The MIT Club of Beijing is an MIT recognized organization supported by volunteers.  Its mission is to connect alumni and related affiliates in Beijing and nearby, and to build a MIT community which advances the interests of the Institute and serves the community through professional, cultural, educational, service and social programming.

麻省理工学院北京校友会是经学院许可、由志愿者运作的团体，通过专业、文化、教育、服务及联谊等活动，建立在北京及附近地区的校友们之间和与母校的联系与交流。

 

时日 When

2023.08.05 (Saturday)

15:00-18:00 Beijing time

地点 Where

致敬酒吧 Tribute Pub

北京朝阳区朝阳公园好运街

报名 Register

请扫以下二维码报名登记 Please scan below QR code to register

Or use this link.

 

Club of Beijing
Beijing
Beijing, Beijing 100022

value.subject: MIT graduate dental Insurance: Your chance to enroll
value.bodyPreview:
If you want dental insurance for the upcoming year, take action by August 15

MIT Graduate Student Dental Plan: Your chance to enroll
Dear MIT Graduate Student,

Do you want dental insurance for the upcoming academic year? If so, sign up now before t

body.content:
If you want dental insurance for the upcoming year, take action by August 15
MIT Graduate Student Dental Plan: Your chance to enroll
Dear MIT Graduate Student,

Do you want dental insurance for the upcoming academic year? If so, sign up now before the enrollment period closes.
 
About the plan
The MIT Graduate Student Dental Plan is open to all MIT graduate students enrolled in a degree-granting program and their family members. The dental plan is administered by Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts and allows you to receive your dental care on campus.  

If you want the plan, you will need to sign up online through our enrollment partner, Gallagher Student Health. The dental plan is separate from your health insurance, and you will not be automatically enrolled.

Cost
As an individual, the cost to enroll in the plan is $570.72 a year, or $47.56 a month. If you want to enroll one or more of your family members, it will cost $1443.48 a year, or $120.29 a month. The family rate stays the same, no matter how many family members are enrolled.

Here’s what you need to know:
  • Sign up on time. The enrollment period is July 15–August 15. If you don’t sign up by August 15, you will not be able to get dental insurance through MIT for this school year.
     
  • Enroll online at the Gallagher Student Health website. If you already have an account with our partner, Gallagher Student Health, simply log in with your username and password. If you need to create a Gallagher account, instructions are below.
     
  • Choose how you pay. When you sign up, you can pay for the entire year at that time, or you can choose the installment plan — pay for the first three months and then begin paying a smaller amount every month.
If you pay for the entire year, you may pay by credit card or through a one-time debit from your checking account. If you choose the installment plan, you will have to make payments through automatic debits from your checking account. You’ll provide your checking account number and your bank’s routing number and give Gallagher permission (or “authorization”) to electronically withdraw money from your account. First, Gallagher will take an initial payment for the first three months of coverage. After that, Gallagher will withdraw monthly installment payments starting on the same date the next month.

How to create a Gallagher account

If you haven’t had a Gallagher account in the past, you should have received an email with the subject line, “Verify your Gallagher Student Health Account.” This email will contain a link and temporary password that you will use to log into the Gallagher Student Health website. Follow the link to log in, and create a new, unique password when prompted. If you have not received an email from Gallagher, contact their customer service team by calling 1-844-333-1466.

Watch your inbox for emails from Gallagher Student Health. After you enroll, Gallagher will send you emails with information about your dental insurance.

Still have questions? View our FAQ.
 

Wishing you good health,

MIT Student Insurance Office
Copyright © 2023 MIT Medical, All rights reserved.
You are receiving this message because you are enrolled at MIT for the upcoming school year.

Our mailing address is:
MIT Medical
77 Massachusetts Ave
Cambridge, MA 02139-4301

Add us to your address book


Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can update your preferences or unsubscribe from this list.

value.subject: Reminder: MIT Personal Certificates Expire July 30
value.bodyPreview:
Good day,

Certificates allow you to access secure web services at MIT, such as Atlas and WebSIS, or to access any MIT certificate-protected site. Certificates obtained from Information Systems and Technology (IS&T) within the past year are set to expir

body.content:
Good day,

Certificates allow you to access secure web services at MIT, such as Atlas and WebSIS, or to access any MIT certificate-protected site. Certificates obtained from Information Systems and Technology (IS&T) within the past year are set to expire on July 30, 2023.

To ensure continued access to these secured sites, please plan to renew your certificates on all desktop and mobile devices by July 30, 2023. This renewal process is not automatic, and there are some steps you will need to take to get new ones.

Step One: Before obtaining your certificates

  • If your password is over one year old, you will be prompted to change it during the certificate renewal process. For more information and tips on how to choose a strong password, see: Strong Passwords
  • Note: If your Windows computer is on the MIT domain and you are not on campus, refer to this article about changing your password to make sure you will be able to log into your computer with your new password. (You are on the MIT domain if you see "Sign in to: ATHENA.MIT.EDU" at the bottom of the Windows logon screen.)
  • Have your Duo-equipped phone or device handy. The certificate installation process requires Duo two-factor authentication.

Step Two: Obtaining your certificates

  • If you use MacOS or Windows, update your web browser to the most current version, then download and run the latest version of the CertAid app from IS&T. Supported browsers include Safari, Edge, Chrome, and Firefox.
  • For iPhone and iPad (iOS) users: See these step-by-step instructions in the Knowledge Base. 
  • For Android users: See these step-by-step instructions in the Knowledge Base.

Please note: If you use multiple devices and browsers, you will need to obtain a new certificate for each browser on each device. For more information, see: Certificates at MIT.

Step Three: Deleting your expired certificates

  • It is recommended that, after installing your new certificates, you delete your expired ones. Failure to do so may cause problems accessing certificate-protected sites. We encourage the MIT community to use CertAid, which will prompt you to delete expired certificates if any are detected.
  • For more information, see: Deleting your expired certificates.

Note for users who encrypt email: Do not delete an expired certificate if you have used it to sign or receive encrypted email. For more information on what to do in that case, see the Export or Back Up Your MIT Personal Certificates page.

If you have any questions or concerns, email the IS&T Service Desk at servicedesk@mit.edu or call 617-253-1101.

Sincerely,

Kyle Filipe
Senior Director, IT Support Services
MIT Information Systems & Technology (IS&T)

A copy of this email is available at: http://kb.mit.edu/confluence/x/pzLSCQ

Information Systems and Technology
Massachusetts Institute of Technology
77 Massachusetts Avenue, Cambridge, MA 02139

This e-mail has been sent to jiannan@mit.edu, click here to unsubscribe.

Networking in the U.S. American Context

Thursday, July 13

[VIRTUAL]
Register on Handshake

Does the idea of networking stress you out? Or worse, do you avoid it because it sounds so unpleasant? In this workshop, w

body.content:
This week on Zoom!

Networking in the U.S. American Context

Thursday, July 13
12pm to 1pm
[VIRTUAL]
Register on Handshake

Does the idea of networking stress you out? Or worse, do you avoid it because it sounds so unpleasant? In this workshop, we’ll lay out the basics of networking, informational interviewing, and the US American work culture. You’ll learn why a strong basis is crucial for your career first steps and how to go about mastering the art of networking in the US.

We recommend taking the Globe Smart Quiz in advance of this event.

This workshop is a collaboration of the International Students Office (ISO) and Career Advising & Professional Development (CAPD).

Register

value.subject: John Horton Questions
value.bodyPreview:
Hi all,

Welcome back from Spring Break!

We will hear from Sloan Professor John Horton in the first hour of class on Wednesday. He will discuss this paper: "Large Language Models as Simulated Economic Agents: What Can We Learn from Homo Silicus?"
Pl

body.content:
Hi all,

Welcome back from Spring Break!

We will hear from Sloan Professor John Horton in the first hour of class on Wednesday. He will discuss this paper: "Large Language Models as Simulated Economic Agents: What Can We Learn from Homo Silicus?"
Please read this before class on Wednesday. If you can submit 2 questions for extra credit by tomorrow night, please do. There is a place to submit them on Canvas, or you can email us here with your questions.

Another very related paper that may be of interest is this one: "Out of One, Many: Using Language Models to Simulate Human Samples" by Lisa Argyle et. al.

Looking forward to hearing all your thoughts on these ideas on Wednesday (in person). We have a lot of current events to discuss as a group in the second hour of class as well!

See you all again soon.

Hope & team





 
This email was sent to jiannan@mit.edu

value.subject: Re: About my current situation on course 15.563
value.bodyPreview:
Hi Jiannan,

I'm so sorry to hear that -- I hope your family is doing ok.

Yes, you can work remotely. All the lectures should be available on Canvas. Because Google products don't always work in China, let me know if you need help accessing the assig

body.content:
Hi Jiannan,

I'm so sorry to hear that -- I hope your family is doing ok.

Yes, you can work remotely. All the lectures should be available on Canvas. Because Google products don't always work in China, let me know if you need help accessing the assignments.

Best,
Manish

On Fri, Mar 31, 2023 at 7:39 AM Jiannan Cao <jiannan@mit.edu> wrote:

Hi Prof. Raghavan,

 

I returned to Beijing on this Monday, since one of my family members just encountered a heart attack issue on Sunday evening and finished a successful operation this Monday.

Since I need time accompany my family, I cannot participate in the course in person in the second half of the term.
Could I continue work on this course remotely, including the assignments? 


Best,
Jiannan
